question: What is PublishJockey?
answer: PublishJockey is a professional publishing tool that transforms your manuscripts into publication-ready PDFs that meet industry standards. Unlike basic Word-to-PDF exports, PublishJockey applies professional design intelligence, perfect typography, and technical accuracy to create documents that look like they came from a professional publisher.

question: What's the difference between Word-to-PDF and PublishJockey?
answer:
The difference is substantial. Independent evaluations by Claude and ChatGPT scored PublishJockey at 96/100 (A+) versus Word-to-PDF at 66/100 (D). PublishJockey delivers:

• Perfect table of contents with zero errors (vs Word's "Error! Bookmark not defined")
• Professional book layout with balanced margins (vs Word's standard document look)
• Publication-ready typography and font rendering (vs Word's generic, uneven spacing)
• Proper metadata and accessibility tagging (vs Word's minimal structure)
• Print-ready files that pass preflight checks (vs Word's files requiring major fixes)

A Word-to-PDF says "here's my document." A PublishJockey PDF says "here's my book."

question: Why can't I just use Microsoft Word to create my PDF?
answer:
Word is an incredible writing tool, but it's not a publishing tool. Word-to-PDF exports suffer from:

1. Broken TOCs & Field Codes: The infamous "Error! Bookmark not defined." ruins professional credibility
2. No Publishing Logic: Word doesn't understand front matter, roman numerals, or design rhythm
3. Rigid Layout Engine: Margins, text flow, and typography are mechanical, not artistic
4. Lack of Metadata: Word exports don't optimize for searchability, accessibility, or navigation
5. Time Lost in Post-Processing: Hours spent fixing issues that still look "office-made," not "publisher-made"

PublishJockey was built specifically for authors, educators, and professionals who want publication-quality results automatically.

answer: Yes! You can update your content and regenerate your professional PDF as many times as needed within your plan limits. Each generation applies the same professional standards, ensuring consistency across all versions of your work.

question: Why does Word create broken table of contents with 'Error! Bookmark not defined'?
answer:
This is one of the most common and frustrating issues with Word-to-PDF exports. It happens because:

• Word uses field codes that break during PDF conversion
• Bookmark references don't translate properly to PDF format
• Manual TOC updates are required but often missed
• Word's export process isn't designed for publishing

PublishJockey eliminates this problem entirely. Our system generates perfect, error-free table of contents with working links every single time. This alone is worth switching from Word-to-PDF.

question: How can readers tell the difference between an amateur PDF and a professional one?
answer:
Readers may not consciously notice specific technical details, but they absolutely feel the difference:

**Amateur PDFs (Word-to-PDF):**
• Feel like office documents
• Uneven spacing and margins
• Generic, default fonts
• Broken navigation links
• Impression: "work in progress"

**Professional PDFs (PublishJockey):**
• Feel like published books
• Balanced, breathing layout
• Crisp, optimized typography
• Perfect navigation structure
• Impression: "crafted, intentional, premium"

The distinction is both technical and emotional. Professional presentation builds trust and perceived value.

question: How does PublishJockey handle copyright protection for my work?
answer:
Copyright protection is a legal right, not a technical one. This means no software application can prevent others from copying or misusing your work — only the law can enforce copyright.

However, with our system, you retain full copyright and ownership of everything you upload and create. We never claim rights to your content, and we only use it to provide the services you've requested. Your materials remain your intellectual property at all times.
